title: Microcosm-dependent degradation of nonwoven fabric in surgical masks by endophytic fungi Aspergillus bridgerii
source: ScienceDirect Publication: Journal of Hazardous Materials
excerpt: Publication date: 15 February 2026Source: Journal of Hazardous Materials, Volume 504Author(s): Ramya Duraisamy, Bhuvaneshwari. S, Philip. A, VM Vishnu, P. Sribalaji, Agnieszka Saeid, Jemima Balaselvi Juliana. S, Jennifer Michellin Kiruba N
summary: Microcosm-dependent degradation of nonwoven fabric in surgical masks by endophytic fungi Aspergillus bridgerii. Microcosm is responsible for degradation of the fabric in the surgical masks. The material can then be used to make other surgical masks, such as surgical gowns.
ai_summary: Microcosm-dependent degradation of nonwoven fabric in surgical masks by endophytic fungi Aspergillus bridgerii. Microcosm is responsible for degradation of the fabric in the surgical masks. The material can then be used to make other surgical masks, such as surgical gowns.

title: Micro-nanobubble oxygenation irrigation ameliorates saline-alkali soil properties, cotton physiology, and yield under different salt stress levels
source: Frontiers in Plant Science | New and Recent Articles
excerpt: BackgroundAddressing soil saline-alkalization is crucial for sustaining cotton production in the arid regions of Xinjiang. This study investigates the efficacy of Micro-Nanobubble oxygenated irrigation (MNBs) compared with conventional flooding (CF) in ameliorating saline-alkali soil and enhancing cotton growth.MethodsA field microplot experiment was conducted across four soil salinity levels (0, 3%, 6%, and 9%, with sulfate as the dominant salt).ResultsThe results demonstrated that MNBs effectively reduced topsoil (0~20 cm) salinity and mitigated its associated alkalinity stress by facilitati
summary: Micro-nanobubble oxygenated irrigation (MNBs) ameliorates saline-alkali soil properties, cotton physiology, and yield under different salt stress levels. Results demonstrated that MNBs effectively reduced topsoil salinity and mitigated its associated alkalinity stress by facilitati.
ai_summary: Micro-nanobubble oxygenated irrigation (MNBs) ameliorates saline-alkali soil properties, cotton physiology, and yield under different salt stress levels. Results demonstrated that MNBs effectively reduced topsoil salinity and mitigated its associated alkalinity stress by facilitati.

title: Antibacterial and Cytotoxic Decahydrofluorene-Class Alkaloids from the Marine-Derived Fungus Penicillium sp. SCSIO 41512
source: acs: Journal of Natural Products: Table of Contents
excerpt: Journal of Natural Products, Volume 89, Issue 1, Page 128-138, January 23, 2026.
summary: Fungus Penicillium sp. sp. is a marine-Derived Fungus. It is thought to be one of the most dangerous fungi in the world. It has been linked to a number of diseases including sepsis and bacterial infections. It can also be a source of fungal infections in humans.
